children.text: The flashing in this area has been installed without adequate fall, resulting in water runoff that is causing visible staining, which looks poorly finished and detracts from the overall look of the area.
The Victorian Building Authority’s, Guide to Standards and Tolerances clause 7.11 Parapet flashings/cappings states that

‘Parapet flashings/cappings are defective if a minimum fall of three degrees is not provided across the width of the flashing to divert water runoff from dripping down the fascia and causing unsightly staining’ .
The builder warrants that the work will be carried out in
, which is not the case in this area, and will require that this area be rectified.
